poem:
Title: "In the Glow of the Late Show"

A crooning clock marks the tender hour,  
No Madonna waltzes on stage in power.  
Pulses pound, the lawsuit scans,  
A mad jigsaw of fans' heart-spans.   
Who counts minutes when music shares its night?  
Yet promise sparks when stars ignite.  
Let lawyers dance in litigious delight,  
While fan hearts throb 'neath concert light.
